title: The ratio between the ages of Ram and Mohan is 4:5 and that between Mohan and Anil is 5:6. If the sum of the age of three is 99 years, how old is Mohan? - Quora

response.answer_text: The ratio between the ages of Ram and Mohan is 4:5 and that between Mohan and Anil is 5:6. If the sum of the age of three is 99 years, how old is Mohan? Solution: Ram : Mohan = 4:5 or 20:25 Mohan : Anil = 5:6 or 25:30 Ram : Mohan : Anil = 20 : 25 : 30 20x+25x+30x = 75x = 99, or x = 99/75 Anil is 30*99/75 = 39.6 years, Mohan is 25*99/75 = 33 years and Ram is 20*99/75 = 26.4 years. Answer.

Let the age of Ram be X Age of Mohan be Y And Age of Anil be Z X/Y = 4/5 5X - 4Y = 0 (i) Y/ Z = 5/6 6Y - 5Z = 0 (ii) X+Y+Z = 99 (iii) Solving eq i, ii, iii X = 26.4 Y=33 Z=39.6 So Mohan is 33 years old
Ram 4x Mohan 5x Anil 6x years. 15 x = 99 so x = 33/5 MOHAN is 33 years old Anil 198/5 = 39.6 years Ram 26.4 years.
